Description.val: Air Vigilance systems collect critical intelligence data on emerging threat aerial systems.The intelligence data provides early warning of operations in restricted airspace to ensure force protection. An Air Vigilance system is comprised of a key 'Hub' server unit configured and fielded with a single or multiple sub-component sensors. System Quantities are based upon 'Hub' units. Operational details are classified.

Justification.val: FY 2016 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $8.224 million procures hardware and software components for the operational force and provides for New Equipment Training. All funding is for Compo 1 (Active Component).

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val:
The Air Vigilance program receives full RDT&E funding support in RDT&E 6.4 PE 0603766.907 "Tactical Exploitation of National Capabilities (MIP)" and RDT&E 6.5 PE 0605766.DX9 "National Integration to Tactical Systems (MIP)".

W60001 Line renamed to "Air Vigilance" in FY15.
